samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began developing it in the early 1990s, with the first version released in 1995. The language was named "R" partly after the first letter of both creators' first names, and also as a nod to the S programming language, which R was designed to be an implementation of. R is now maintained by the R Core Team and has become one of the most widely used programming languages for statistical computing and data analysis.

R is now maintained by the R Core Team and has become one of the most widely used programming languages for statistical computing and data analysis.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R after its initial development began in the 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R after its initial development began in the 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
